availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Greenberry Reid (Bourbon County, KY, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Bourbon County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Amanda Reid. Father of John W. Reid, George Reid, Agnes Reid, Louisa Reid, Henry Reid, and Amanda J. Reid. Farmer in Bourbon County in 1850. Farmer in Bourbon County in 1860. Owned 5 enslaved persons in 1860. Served in the 40th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment as captain from September 27, 1863 to December 30, 1864. Served in the Bourbon County Militia (Kentucky National Legion) as captain in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District no. 1, p. 274A-274B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District no. 1, p. 527.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District no. 1, p. 103.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Paris, p. 396.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1867), 436.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 434.
KYR-0001-008-0002.
